model_answer: I would select B: Event 3 – A continued, guided exploration through the ruins (tourists moving around, spotting animals) while discussing site history like a temple and sacrifices. This event seems to be the most relevant to the subsequent events as it provides context on the group's activities and discussions regarding the historical significance of Machu Picchu.

The preceding moment that most plausibly caused the result sub-event in event 10 was likely option A: Event 5 – On the trail, a speaker declares Machu Picchu “conquered” and states the plan to meet up and head back down to the hotel and then to Cusco. This event sets the stage for the subsequent events leading up to the final bus ride and return to the hotel.
